##In Wuhan, a poet stopped writing poetry

Wechat, renwumag1980

Feature Introduction, the best Chinese character report

With a base in his chest and no knife in his hand, he could only stimulate the monster with words. "

By Zhang Yue

Editor | locust tree

The missing month

The poet Kohiki kept four pots of flowers on his veranda, roses, orchids, plantains, and an unknown wild Bush, which he had dug up while walking on the Luojia Shan. The weather in Wuhan is gloomy. It is hot and humid in summer and cold in winter. He is lazy. It takes him several days to remember to water once.

On February 21, after lunch, he took a small stool and sat on the balcony, smoking and basking in the Sun. It was his private place, where he could catch his breath late at night when he could not write poems or articles. Looking down from the high-rise, the neighborhood next to the empty, no one, the occasional delivery through, after the past, it is empty, the road is empty, very few cars. Xiaoyin sat there, smoking while watching, do not remember how long to sit, occasionally bow his head, found a few potted flowers look a little bad, some withered chlorophytum, many leaves withered; rose and wild thorns have lost quite many leaves; The soil dried up in all four flowerpots. He finally remembered that he had not watered the flowers for a long time. "He seemed to forget that they were there. "

This is day thirty of the siege of Wuhan.

He felt that he had lost his sense of time. Wuhan and the field connected to the passage, the Yangtze River tunnel, the main traffic lane block, constantly increase the code, and finally the Large Iron Gate area. He went downstairs to the fountain next to a cigarette, within two minutes of the community was persuaded to go back. It was a kind of imprisonment, and in his eyes, the days were no longer a day to day thing, but a lump, or rather, a lump. "there is no gap or difference between day and day. It comes like a cloud. After a few days, you realize the time has passed. "He said.

He was walking around the house in his long Johns. I smoke more, like a dozen a day. The hair is getting longer, especially the sideburns. Earlier in an interview with the media, the other side asked him to take a photo of himself, he refused, "I am unkempt for more than a month, completely can not see people. ". "

His memory slowed, and he was impressed by what had happened in January, which required careful reflection. A few days earlier, he had laughed at a joke, but what was it? He can't remember. In an interview with people, he asked, somewhat uncertainly, "what's the date today? "? "March 1st. "On the other end of the line, he seemed startled. Yes, it's march, the plum trees downstairs are in bloom, the earliest in the city, and for the poet who has lived here for 47 years, "a whole month has disappeared. "

"disappear" in a month, the vast majority of Wuhan people no longer need to go to work, tomorrow there is nothing important to do. So did Kohiki, who didn't have to go to the nearby Wuhan University to experiment and teach civil engineering, and didn't have to meet his friends who talked poetry and ate and drank. Black and white, he stayed up until five o'clock in the morning, get up at noon to cook for his son, stir-fry a pepper shredded meat, add a quick green vegetables, and then steamed eggs. You have to doze off in the afternoon, or you'll end up half-asleep. And then I wake up reading on the living room couch. He was recently reading an American anthropologist, James Scott, who wrote the art of evasion, about how the mountain people of Southeast Asia had fled from the state. He was impressed by a Burmese Ballad in the book: "The pagoda is complete, but the country is gone. Bored with his book, He went out to the balcony to take a breath, overlooking the empty city at his feet. Five o'clock should go to cook, son on the second year of high school, at home every day self-study, must pay attention to nutrition, the evening can stew a beef to eat.

At dinner, father and son Chat for a while. Kohiki recently recommended to his son Shen Congwen's notes on a journey to Hunan. As he ate, he told him how Shen Congwen went to the castle tower to watch the killing, how he secretly went swimming, and how he cheated his old master. The teenager is not anxious, to this sudden epidemic, isolation, like a long holiday general happiness.

Many years ago, Kohiki wrote a poem called fallen leaves. "There's nothing left to care about / except family, dinner and the weather. "He did not think that one day he would actually live such a life.

Wuhan under a few days of continuous rain, cooling, a small diversion of the heating. The balcony is the junction of hot and cold, sitting there in the afternoon, there is a trace of unreal. He had no real problems compared to the desperate people in the hospital. The refrigerator is full of vegetables and meat, there are still many packets of hotpot base on the balcony, smoke enough to smoke into a warmer spring, the health and well-being of his family and friends around him, in addition to not being free, his life seems normal and happy, if, to ignore the grief that follows you everywhere.

The poet quote

Write truly, consistently and firmly

Xiao Yin, 51, has lived in Wuhan for 47 years. When he was a boy, he lived with his parents in Wushe, a faculty member at Wuhan Water Conservancy and Electric Power College. The college was not Wuhan University at that time. He spent his youth and youth on campus, running all over Luojia Shan, get to know the fruit, plants and animals of the hills, the sparkling water and fish of East L. , the bookstore of the school and the late-night stand outside. He grew up here, fell in love, got married, had children, and still lives less than three kilometers from the university's street corner. Wuhan to him, "like breathing, all the people you know are here, all the memories are here, it is already your life, you can not have the idea of trying to separate from it. ". "

On isolated nights, he'd video chat with friends, drink whiskey through a screen, and by the end of the month, seven or eight bottles were gone. One day, there were nine people in the video chat group, talking about people dying around them. Three said relatives and co-workers had died of new pneumonia, and six others had been infected.

Little lead of Wuhan, show frailty. After the video with his friends, he lay in bed and looked at the ceiling for a long time. Xiao Yinguess, there are probably many people like him in this city, looking at the ceiling in silence at night. In Wuhan's words, this situation is called "looking at the sky" , "it means a very helpless situation, fuck it, forget it, anyway, you are powerless to resist. ". "

The night after his death, he saw a video of two young boys delivering a wreath of crumpled wreaths to the Wuhan Central Hospital. They carefully smoothed it away, turned around, took out a whistle and blew. He wept when he saw it. He was always rational in his expression and restrained in his choice of words, except when he spoke of that moment, which he choked uncontrollably. "I used to think life and death were a little pretentious, but now that I'm in it, I feel sad. "

After the city was sealed, he didn't write a single poem.

"In the event of a disaster, whether you should write, whether you should write poems, I think this is a very important issue. The key is how you face your heart as a person in the disaster situation, because you have reencountered this world, you have encountered a new world, not the usual, you think of the world. "He said.

But he's still gonNA write. He said of the role of words, "there is a block in the chest, but no knife in the hand, only through the words to stimulate the numbness of the arrogant monster. ". " On January 22, he began to write a diary. Since then, he has posted a daily "message from Wuhan in the epidemic area" to the public account of "little quoted poems" . He has so far sent 43 pieces.

He recorded the events of the day: The changes in Wuhan's policies, the struggles, the deaths... every night at 11:00 on the computer, his wife and children were asleep, he was writing in the living room. The son has rhinitis, he does not dare to smoke in the living room, smoking became tired of carrying the computer to the kitchen to write, open the exhaust hood. A 2,500 word article typically takes two hours, and a longer, unmanageable amount of time is spent playing hide and seek with the system. He guessed which words needed to be adjusted one by one.

At first, these diaries were only personal records. "This disaster must be a unique event in the whole history of mankind, in the history of Wuhan, and in the history of my life. From the writer's perspective, when something big happens, I write it down. "

He didn't think the record was important, but as the days went by, he realized it might not just be about him. Before the outbreak, his public accounts read between 3,000 and 4,000 articles, and after the outbreak, fifty thousand. By the end of the 20s, he wanted to give up. Tired, searching for the wrong word, searching for it, unable to find it, he felt a splitting headache and a throbbing vein in his temple. He shut off the computer and went to bed. It was the only day off. The next day, I opened my account backstage and found hundreds of messages. Some people were concerned about whether he was ill, some were afraid of what might happen to him?

"You just find that a lot of people are following you. They feel that one person in the disaster area is still alive and can write. This, in turn, puts a strain on you. "

Under the crowd, he hoped that his writing should not have the performance nature, maintains the folk writing position, "that is one kind of independent, or relatively independent posture, is not cooperative in some thinking. " Is literally a step back. As a result, he lost some articles. A friend told him to stop writing while drinking on the video.

Xiao Yin has some friends who write poetry, and they write very little. Maybe they're still writing it, he guessed, but they're not publishing it. Writing can continue in silence. In his view, it is not barbarous to write poetry after a disaster, but it is barbarous to continue it with lies. The only way to fight barbarism is to write truly, consistently and firmly. "It is the lies, not the lives, that keep us from writing. If a writer sees this clearly, and we do not have the ability to refute the lie, we stand together with the true record and the lie, I believe that the truth will win out. "

He no longer wrote poetry, but felt that these diaries could also be called "poetry" , because he did not "force write" , did not fabricate, and did not sing carols.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Yin Xiyuan on the street in Wuhan

"It should live. "

January, the "normal" month of life, feels so far away.

On the night of January 20, Kohiki went to Hankou for a party with some friends. After eating beef hot pot and shrimp in Kewai, he and a friend took a walk on the riverbank, next to the tranquil Yangtze River. Strolling, they walked to the nearby Java Bar, their favorite hangout. In front of the bar is a dilapidated wooden boat, they often joke: "here to drink, is the defeatist Straw boat borrow arrows. ". It was a free and easy place, full of literary and Artistic Youth, most of whom were GE you. Xiao Yin and his friends had a few beers and then dispersed. He remembered the Sunny Day, when the bar was full, people toasting each other, no one wearing masks, no one talking about the new coronavirus.

It was a scene he was accustomed to, and when he drank to his heart's content, poetry was often recited. KOHIKI's poetry also speaks of wine, and in something to do with the Moon, he writes, "that night there was no sorrow or joy let's go to the tavern at the end of the street, let's not talk about fate, like two insects on the grass, flying toward the light. "

In a way, "Java seems to be a paradise. The virus has nothing to do with it. "He said. That same night, Zhong Nanshan announced "human to human" on television, and everything changed dramatically.

Xiaoyin remembers that there was a state-run shop near Hou's house when he was a child. At that time, it was called a co-op. It sold food, candy and hardware. Large Glass Jars held shiny candies, and Kohiki would take a few pennies from his family's toothpaste tubes and go to the three dollar store to buy Ginger Candy, polygonal candies wrapped in Horse Dung paper that would last all afternoon. That was in the early'80s. Nearly 40 years later, Kohiki always remembered the three dollars, perhaps because of the candy, "and felt that he had brought happiness and sweetness. ". "Sanyuan is a gentle and fond of laughing and playing behind the counter with a guitar. He also influenced Sanyuan's playing in college. They had been in the same circles, but they had not thought of exchanging messages. On the last day of February, a friend told him that Sanyuan had died.

His heart sank, but at the end of his diary he only mentioned his old friend, "brother Unpi suddenly told me that Sanyuan had pneumonia last week and was dead. "

"With every word, it cuts into the most painful places, " Kohiki said, "but a calm writer should know that in a situation like this, the dead are gone, if you're watching, then you'll know that the living must go on living. "

He wrote a poem, "It was in the spring, " that says, "the morning man / so slow / they turn a blind eye to things in the flower. " The feeling, "you're still in your normal life, but you don't know it's about to fall apart. "after this February, he said, he would never write a poem like that again. He learned that a normal life can fall apart at any moment.

During the outbreak, he asked the owner of the Java Bar, Fang Wen, how was the bar? Fang Wenda, still open, but only one person in the drink. When the epidemic was at its worst, Fang Wen went to the beach to play football by himself, sending a video message to the children. The Sun was very bright, like a lot of money sprinkled on the face, cloudless, usually bustling pier empty. "What a waste, " Fang said in the video! "

In that moment, Kohiki felt that the city would always return to normal.

But one way or another, people don't go back. "We can't go back to Wuhan. " In his view, even if he did not experience the death before the death of life, the disaster still gave every person in Wuhan Mark, every person who survived, who wrote on the body, "do not die" , after this, will no longer live as before. Emotions, perceptions, views of life and death... Many things can change. I don't know exactly where the changes are going to happen, but I won't know for sure until the day the seal is actually lifted. "said Kohiki.

He hoped that the symbol of "survival" would remind the Times that "in another 17 years, this will not happen again. He hoped that the structure of society as a whole would become better and more stable, instead of falling apart under the impact of a virus. "

No poems, but in a recent essay for the Journal of Poetry, Kohiki recommended the train, written by the Turkish poet Talangi and translated by Yu Guangzhong:

Where are we going? It's late,
Beautiful train, lonely train?
Misery is the sound of your whistle,
It brings back a lot of memories.
Why shouldn't I be waving a towel?
The passengers are more or less related to me.
Go. I hope you have a safe journey,
The bridges are strong, the tunnels are bright.

Where are we going? It's late,

Beautiful train, lonely train?

Misery is the sound of your whistle,

It brings back a lot of memories.

Why shouldn't I be waving a towel?

The passengers are more or less related to me.

Go. I hope you have a safe journey,

The bridges are strong, the tunnels are bright.

A friend made a flowerpot out of wood and planted the green vegetable roots that ate the leaves on the balcony. Over the past few days, has actually grown a small green bud. I don't think it's going to be very good. But that bit of green gives a sense of hope, as he writes in his essay, "He who walks alone in the dark, accustomed to the dark, is often surprised by a match. ". On the balcony, his flowers were in good condition. He watered them carefully and loosened the soil for the wilted hyacinth. "It's impossible for flowers to bloom. Let them live. "
